marketNews.title: US Inflation Above Expectations, Higher-for-Longer Narrative Strengthens
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics on Wednesday (12 February) announced that core inflation in the United States rose year-on-year in January 2025 and exceeded expectations. Details are as follows: Inflation YoY: 3% (consensus: 2.9%, December 2024: 2.9%). Inflation MoM: 0.5% (consensus: 0.3%, December 2024: 0.4%). Core inflation YoY: 3.3% (consensus: 3.1%, December 2024: 3.2%). Core inflation MoM: 0.4% (consensus: 0.3%, December 2024: 0.2%). This development reinforces the higher-for-longer narrative, especially with the risk of an escalation in trade wars. Prior to the inflation release, U.S. President Donald Trump said there would be retaliatory tariffs for all countries that impose tariffs on the United States and announced a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminium imports to the United States. The inflation data release came only one day after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told the U.S. Senate that the Fed is not in a rush to cut interest rates, citing a strong economy, low unemployment and inflation still above the 2% target. Powell also warned that reducing rates too quickly or too much could hinder disinflation progress, reaffirming the Fedâ€™s stance of holding rates steady at the January 2025 meeting. According to the CME FedWatch Tool on Thursday (13 February), the probability that the Fed will cut rates by more than 25 basis points in 2025 fell to 35.2% from 58.1% on 6 February 2025. Following the inflation release, the U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) briefly rose 0.05% to 107.97 before closing down 0.39% at 107.55. The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield also rose 9 basis points to 4.62%. U.S. equity indices closed mixed: Dow Jones -0.50%, S&P 500 -0.27% and Nasdaq +0.12%. In Indonesia, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed weaker by 0.48% on Thursday (13 February). The 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose 1 basis point to 6.63% and the rupiah strengthened 0.17% to 16,368 per U.S. dollar. Key Takeaway: Although expectations for a U.S. rate cut have declined, Bloomberg consensus still expects Bank Indonesia to cut rates by another 50 basis points to 5.25% by the end of 2025. Previously, Bank Indonesia unexpectedly cut the BI Rate by 25 basis points to 5.75% in January 2025 amid a weakening rupiah, a move aimed at supporting economic growth as consumption, employment, investment and exports slowed. This development underscores that volatility from economic data will persist. With the outlook for rate cuts and forward uncertainty, investors can lock in short-term government bond yields that offer attractive risk-reward with lower volatility than long-term bonds. Short-term FR bonds such as PBS032 and PBS003, yielding around 6.3-6.45% with maturities of about 1.5-2 years, are suggested.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Trade Minister Seeks Export Diversification Amid US Protectionism
marketNews.content: Deputy Trade Minister Dyah Roro Esti Widya Putri told Bloomberg on Wednesday (12 February) that the Indonesian government is working to diversify its export markets as U.S. protectionism rises. Although there is no indication that the United States will impose import tariffs on Indonesia, Roro said Indonesia would shift export focus to Asia, Africa and Europe if such tariffs were applied. She explained that Indonesia is actively negotiating bilateral trade agreements and cooperation to broaden export destinations and that Indonesian officials will meet the U.S. ambassador next week, without providing further details.

marketNews.title: Mysteel Global Projects Surge in Processed Nickel Exports from China in 2025
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm Mysteel Global projects that processed nickel exports from China will increase almost three-fold in 2025 due to domestic overcapacity. China recorded a net processed nickel export of 25,000 tonnes in 2024, the first time the country posted a net export of processed nickel. For 2025, Mysteel Global estimates that China will achieve net processed nickel exports of nearly 70,000 tonnes.

marketNews.title: Emirates Global Aluminium Plans 5 GW Nuclear Power Plant in Indonesia, Delays Aluminum Smelter Expansion
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs claimed on Wednesday (12 February) that Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) of the United Arab Emirates plans to build a nuclear power plant in Indonesia with a capacity of up to 5 gigawatts. The ministry also said EGA has postponed its plan to help increase the capacity of the PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium smelter in North Sumatra to 400,000 tonnes per year because of high electricity prices and a lack of low-carbon power. EGA has not commented on the issue.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Plans to Import Around 200,000 Tons of Raw Sugar to Boost Reserves
marketNews.content: The Head of Indonesia's National Food Agency, Arief Prasetyo Adi, said on Thursday (13 February) that the government plans to import about 200,000 tonnes of raw sugar to increase reserves as prices rise ahead of Ramadan. Previously, BPS reported that the average price of white sugar in the first week of February 2025 reached 18,365 rupiah per kilogram, 5% above the highest retail price set by the government. For 2025, the government estimates domestic white sugar production at 2.6 million tonnes and demand at 2.84 million tonnes, while the stock of white sugar at the beginning of February 2025 was 842,000 tonnes. The government has set a raw sugar import quota for industrial use at 3.4 million tonnes in 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Announces Board Changes and New President Director Candidate
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) announced a plan to change its board of directors. Current President Director Jahja Setiaatmadja will be nominated as President Commissioner. Vice President Director Gregory Hendra Lembong is proposed to become the new President Director, replacing Jahja. Director John Kosasih is proposed to become the new Vice President Director. Additionally, Hendra Tanumihardja is proposed as a new board member; he has been Head of the Banking Transaction Solutions Development Division since September 2022. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPST) on 12 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Reports Sharp Decline in Q4 2024 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) reported a net profit of 359 billion rupiah in the fourth quarter of 2024, down 41% year-on-year and 34% quarter-on-quarter. This resulted in a total 2024 net profit of 3.4 trillion rupiah, a 30% decline year-on-year and only 90% of consensus estimates. Revenue in Q4 2024 fell to 7.7 trillion rupiah, down 5% year-on-year and 8% quarter-on-quarter, leading to a 9% year-on-year revenue decline to 35 trillion rupiah for the full year. The profit drop was mainly due to a reduction in operating profit margin to 6.7% (Q4 2023: 10.2%, Q3 2024: 8.7%).

tickerNews.title: PTRO Secures Record Backlog of 64.3 Trillion Rupiah in 2024
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) announced a contract backlog (backlog) of 64.3 trillion rupiah for 2024, marking an all-time high. The contracts include a mining services agreement with PT Pasir Bara Prima worth 17.4 trillion rupiah, a project with BP Berau Ltd. for Ubadari and Tangguh valued at 4.6 trillion rupiah, and a contract with Vale Indonesia (INCO) for the Pomalaa mine worth 2.8 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DMAS Posts 210 Billion Rupiah Net Profit in Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) reported a net profit of 210 billion rupiah in the fourth quarter of 2024, down 34% quarter-on-quarter and 65% year-on-year. The full-year 2024 net profit reached 1.33 trillion rupiah, a 10.2% increase year-on-year. 2024 performance was driven by: 1) revenue growth to 2.03 trillion rupiah (+5.8% YoY) with revenue recognition rising to 1.78 trillion rupiah (+8.9% YoY) from industrial sales; 2) gross profit margin expansion to 69.6% (+63 basis points YoY); and 3) net profit margin expansion to 65.6% (+260 basis points YoY) supported by a 41% YoY increase in other income such as interest income and gains from asset management activities.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Announces Resignation of Four Top Executives
tickerNews.content: The director of Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAA), Andre Tanudjaja, said that the resignation of four senior executives at Erajaya Swasembada was mainly due to personal interests. Previously, ERAA announced the planned resignation of President Commissioner Ardy Hady Wijaya and three board members: Elly, Mitchella Ardy Hady Wijaya, and Keith Ardy Hady Wijaya. Mitchella and Ardy are children of Ardy Hady Wijaya, and Andre mentioned they will focus on the family business after stepping down. The resignations will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 19 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Shares Bought by PT Investasi Sukses Bersama
tickerNews.content: The digital solutions provider PT Investasi Sukses Bersama purchased approximately 6.08 million shares of WIFI at an average price of 1,530 rupiah per share on 11 February 2025. The total transaction value was about 9.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Investasi Sukses Bersama's ownership in WIFI increased from roughly 50.11% to about 50.37%.

tickerNews.title: CNMA Plans Share Buyback Up to 300 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sejahtera Raya (CNMA) plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 300 billion rupiah. The maximum buyback price is set at 270 rupiah per share. The plan will be discussed at the Ordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPST) on 24 March 2025, with execution expected to occur within 12 months after shareholder approval.

tickerNews.title: KLIN Acquired by PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia
tickerNews.content: Klinko Karya Imaji (KLIN) announced that PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia acquired approximately 784.5 million shares (60%) of the company from President Director Anggun Satriya Supanji at a price of 31 rupiah per share. The total transaction value was 24.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia will become the new controlling shareholder of KLIN and will be required to make a mandatory tender offer for the remaining shares.

tickerNews.title: MLPT Considers Stock Split to Improve Liquidity
tickerNews.content: Multipolar Technology (MLPT) President Director Wahyudi Chandra said the company is conducting a comprehensive study on options to improve stock liquidity, including a possible stock split. He noted that the decision requires in-depth analysis and discussions with major shareholders, particularly Multipolar (MLPL).

tickerNews.title: MINA Plans Large Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA) plans to conduct a rights issue of approximately 3.3 billion new shares, resulting in a maximum dilution of 33.3%. The issue price and ratio have not been announced. Proceeds will be used for working capital and/or capital participation in subsidiaries. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 21 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: GGRP Announces Rights Issue for Low-Carbon Steel Business
tickerNews.content: Gunung Raja Paksi (GGRP) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 12 billion new shares, resulting in a maximum dilution of 49.77%. The issue price and ratio have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used to develop a low-carbon steel business. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 24 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: MTWI Shares Sold by BPII Reducing Ownership
tickerNews.content: Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance (MTWI) shareholder Batavia Prosperindo Internasional (BPII) sold approximately 11.9 million MTWI shares at an average price of 151 rupiah per share between 17 January and 6 February 2025. The total transaction value was about 1.8 billion rupiah. After the sale, BPII's ownership in MTWI fell from 87.27% to 86.86%.

tickerNews.title: BPII Reduces Stake in MTWI After Share Sale
tickerNews.content: Batavia Prosperindo Internasional (BPII) sold approximately 11.9 million shares of Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance (MTWI) at an average price of 151 rupiah per share between 17 January and 6 February 2025, decreasing its ownership from 87.27% to 86.86%. The transaction value was about 1.8 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: WOWS Shareholder Increases Stake by Buying 214.9 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Ginting Jaya Energi (WOWS) shareholder Robby Adijaya purchased approximately 214.9 million WOWS shares at an average price of 50 rupiah per share on 24 January 2025. The total transaction value was about 10.7 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Robby Adijaya's ownership in WOWS rose from 6.78% to 8.68%.
